byline.original: By ANDY NEWMAN and AL BAKER

abstract: At least three deer -- the first seen in Brooklyn in many years -- were found near the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. One had its legs bound with twine. Another got caught in a fence and injured itself so badly it had to be euthanized.
snippet: At least three deer -- the first seen in Brooklyn in many years -- were found near the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. One had its legs bound with twine. Another got caught in a fence and injured itself so badly it had to be euthanized.

headline.main: Deer Appear on Brooklyn Shore, in Disturbing Circumstances
